Genome Integrity | The Sackler Institute                                                   Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             The Sackler Institute                                                                                  Home   PhD Program   MD/PhD Program   Summer Undergraduate Research Program (SURP)                                  Home PhD Program Academics PhD Training Programs Genome Integrity            Print  Email               - A + A                                         PhD Program      Sackler Institute Administration     open/close   Admissions   Faculty at the Sackler Institute     open/close   Academics  PhD Training Programs  Biomedical Imaging   Biomedical Informatics   Cellular and Molecular Biology   Developmental Genetics   Genome Integrity   Immunology & Inflammation   Microbiology   Molecular Biophysics   Molecular Oncology and Tumor Immunology   Molecular Pharmacology   Neuroscience & Physiology   Pathobiology & Translational Medicine   Stem Cell Biology     Spring 2015   Academic Timeline   Academic Requirements   Rotation Information - PhD Program       open/close   Student Life   Contact the Sackler Institute                                                                                                    Genome Integrity                                          See Related:   Genome Integrity Website Download:   Course Sheet   Program Overview   Effective maintenance and interpretation of the genome is essential for normal cell division, tissue homeostasis, and cellular and organismal fitness. DNA damage and errors in DNA replication, recombination and repair, and epigenetic mechanisms all contribute to genomic instability and tumor progression. Many of the basic aspects of genome integrity such as how cells sense and process damage and how epigenetic marks are propagated, are still not understood. Insights into these processes will require a fundamental understanding of genome biology along with the use of model systems.   The genome integrity training program will harness the growing strength in genome research at the NYU SOM and the NYU downtown campus to prepare students for modern research in genome biology and its application to human disease. The program aims at a) providing in depth understanding of the molecular mechanisms by which cells detect, signal, and repair DNA damage to ensure faithful chromosome propagation and b) understanding how these mechanisms function in the context of tissue homeostasis and cellular and organismal fitness. The program builds on a strong core of researchers with expertise in multiple aspects of genome biology across a broad range of research areas including Cancer biology, Immunology, and Stem Cell research. Genome Integrity Training Program                                                                                     Home   About Us   Curriculum   Faculty   Links   Events                                  Home            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                                                   Genome Integrity Training Program                                          The Genome Integrity program trains graduate students in the principles of genome organization and function with emphasis on cellular and molecular mechanisms as they relate to organismal fitness and disease processes. The program harnesses the growing strength in genome integrity at NYUSOM and in the Department of Biology at NYU to provide students with basic knowledge in the fundamental principles of biology and its more specific applications to genome function.
